head.title: email : Webview : RPS Direct - Saturday, April 11, 2020

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Saturday, April 11, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, I hope you had a chance to enjoy the beautiful spring weather today! See below for a few critical reminders. The high school Edgenuity modules on RPS@Home are now live! To access them, first review this document to figure out which course/s you need and then review this document to see how to log in. Edgenuity needs a little more time to set up access for our middle school students who are enrolled in high school courses. I'll update everyone on where things stand with this on Monday. Thank you for your patience! We have a very detailed guidance document for high school students so please take a moment to review it if you're a high school student yourself or if you have one in your life. Did you know we have on-demand tutoring via RPS@Home? Check it out! With great appreciation, Jason Shout-outs! – Please keep sending them to me at jkamras@rvaschools.net (mailto:jkamras@rvaschools.net)! Thank you so much to everyone at RPS. I am proud to be a teacher and and RPS parent. I want to give a huge shoutout to Linda Shapanka. She drove to my house on a
meta.name: description

Thank you for your patience! div.span: I hope you had a chance to enjoy the beautiful spring weather today! See below for a few critical reminders.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: The high school Edgenuity modules on RPS@Home are now live! To access them, first review this document to figure out which course/s you need and then review this document to see how to log in.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Edgenuity needs a little more time to set up access for our middle school students who are enrolled in high school courses. I'll update everyone on where things stand with this on Monday. Thank you for your patience!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: We have a very detailed guidance document for high school students so please take a moment to review it if you're a high school student yourself or if you have one in your life.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Did you know we have on-demand tutoring via RPS@Home? Check it out!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Please keep sending them to me at jkamras@rvaschools.net!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Thank you so much to everyone at RPS. I am proud to be a teacher and and RPS parent. I want to give a huge shoutout to Linda Shapanka. She drove to my house on a Saturday morning to tune my daughter’s viola!! With amazing COVID precautions, she cleaned and tuned the viola while my daughter learned from her on the front porch. She will be so excited to practice again!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I’d like to give a shoutout to Ms. Green, our principal at Broad Rock. She’s everything a principal should be - kind, talented, loving, creative, and courageous. She is a great leader and loves kids and staff. We are lucky to have her!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: A big shout out to Ms. Lee, the 8th grade counselor from Elkhart Thompson. She has helped my daughter to navigate how to find the information on RPS@Home and keeps us informed. I also want to thank the principal, Ms. Murphy, for sending me information in a timely manner.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Thank you to Tracy Epp as well as RPS staff and also many volunteers who are currently helping in any way possible. We appreciate you all!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I want to give a shoutout to the teachers at Overby Sheppard Elementary. I have a rising 6th grader and a rising 1st grader. Their teachers have been checking on them faithfully. Huge s/o to Ms. Goodwyn, my son's kindergarten teacher...She goes above and beyond to assist him. She noticed his speech impediment and went straight to getting him the speech therapy he needed. She recently sent a postcard saying how much she missed him. It really made him happy. Also shout-outs to Mr. Samuels, Ms. Burton, and the school psychologist for reaching out virtually to discuss my son's speech. I appreciate all of you and can’t wait to return next school year.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a special shoutout to Mr. D. Samuels, Assistant Principal at Overby Sheppard. Mr. Samuels goes above and beyond for his students during the school year and has done the same during this pandemic. At a time where he is caring for his family, he is also caring for his students...Mr. Samuels is always helping make sure all of our children succeed.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a shout out to Mr. McLane Grow, Honors Earth Science teacher at Albert Hill Middle School for helping students continue learning by sending updated work for them each week, bringing the class together online, and keeping patents and students informed about requirements for 8th graders to complete their work and prepare for 9th grade. His dedication is awesome; his commitment commendable. Wish we could clone him!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I am the Instructional Compliance Coordinator at ESH Greene Elementary. I want to give a shout out to my Assistant Principal, Ms. Holmes, for being extremely flexible and supportive by helping me complete virtual meetings to stay in compliance with exceptional education requirements. I also want to thank my whole exceptional education staff, including Ms. Thanadar, Ms. Dombo, Ms. Koch, Ms. Mannion, Ms. Clotter, Ms. Branch, Ms. Henderson, Ms. Morgan, Ms. Mallard, Ms. Taylor, Ms. Kallon, and all the general education teachers who have participated in virtual meetings and offered support to our parents and students. Thank you!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I want to give a shout out to Ms. Motley, 2nd grade teacher at Linwood Holton. She has started a zoom meeting for her class and it’s given my son a way to connect with his friends that is sorely needed.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a huge shout out to Bonnie Greene, elementary art teacher at Southampton Elementary. She offered up a wonderful virtual lesson for visual arts as part of the RPS@Home initiative. My first grader and I created our own coral reef art project today and although I had planned to just do one part of the lesson each week, my son was so excited about it that we finished the entire project. I am so thankful for the support for teaching and learning at home during this strange time.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Thank you to Dr. Epp, Autumn Nabors and the entire curriculum and instruction department for pulling together such a simple and organized platform for all of us at home and for your leadership during this time as well. I'm so proud of RPS.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Principal Hines is continuing to offer daily assistance at various locations in the East End, serving students while encouraging them to bring their peers. Unknowingly to her, I was impressed to hear students addressed by first names with an inquiry of their well being. The school closings have been detrimental to students, school staff, families and our communities, but having a dedicated RPS leader display sincere dedication, encouragement and great concern for many is needed and greatly appreciated.
